TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ECDsa extends System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm

Docs.summary: Provides an abstract base class that encapsulates the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class serves as the abstract base class for <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng> derivations.

MemberSignature.Value: protected ECDsa ();
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called by classes that derive from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa> class. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng> class is the only implementation currently supported by the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. You may provide your own custom implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create ();
.method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the default implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).
Docs.returns: A new instance of the default implementation () of this class.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create (string algorithm);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create(string algorithm) cil managed

Docs.param:
The name of an ECDSA implementation. The following strings all refer to the same implementation, which is the only implementation currently supported in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]:
\- "ECDsa"
\- "ECDsaCng"
\- "System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng"
You can also provide the name of a custom ECDSA implementation.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the specified implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).
Docs.returns: A new instance of the specified implementation of this class. If the specified algorithm name does not map to an ECDSA implementation, this method returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you develop your own implementation of an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa> object, you can use the Create method overload to create a custom `algorithm` string that specifies your implementation.
If you specify a custom value for the `algorithm` parameter, the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptoConfig> object will use it to determine whether an ECDSA object can be created.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual byte[] HashData (System.IO.Stream data, System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] HashData(class System.IO.Stream data, valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm) cil managed

Docs.param: The binary stream to hash.
The algorithm to use to hash the data.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, computes the hash value of the specified binary stream by using the specified hashing algorithm.
Docs.exception: A derived class must override this method.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual byte[] HashData (byte[] data, int offset, int count, System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm);

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] HashData(unsigned int8[] data, int32 offset, int32 count, valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm) cil managed

Docs.param: The data to be hashed.
The index of the first byte in `data` to be hashed.
The number of bytes to hash.
The algorithm to use to hash the data.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, computes the hash value of the specified portion of a byte array by using the specified hashing algorithm.
Docs.exception: A derived class must override this method.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string KeyExchangeAlgorithm { get; }
.property instance string KeyExchangeAlgorithm

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the key exchange algorithm.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is inherited from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm> base class.
The Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) is used for digital signature generation; it is not used for key derivation Therefore, this property returns `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string SignatureAlgorithm { get; }
.property instance string SignatureAlgorithm

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the signature algorithm.

Docs.param: The input data for which to compute the hash.
The hash algorithm to use to create the hash value.
Docs.summary: Computes the hash value of the specified byte array using the specified hash algorithm and signs the resulting hash value.
Docs.returns: The ECDSA signature for the specified data.

Docs.param: The hash value of the data that is being signed.
Docs.summary: Generates a digital signature for the specified hash value.
Docs.returns: A digital signature that consists of the given hash value encrypted with the private key.

Docs.param: The signed data.
The signature data to be verified.
The hash algorithm used to create the hash value of the data.
Docs.summary: Verifies that a digital signature is valid by calculating the hash value of the specified data using the specified hash algorithm and comparing it to the provided signature.
Docs.returns: if the signature is valid; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract bool VerifyHash (byte[] hash, byte[] signature);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool VerifyHash(unsigned int8[] hash, unsigned int8[] signature) cil managed

Docs.param: The hash value of a block of data.
The digital signature to be verified.
Docs.summary: Verifies a digital signature against the specified hash value.
Docs.returns: if the hash value equals the decrypted signature; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The signature is first decrypted by using the public key, and then compared to the hash value for verification.
